se.kth.iv1350.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.kth.iv1350.controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the interaction between the 'user' and the program itself. It delegates calls from the view to the correct place.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controller(RegistryCreator registers, Printer printer)
      Creates the controller and assigns values to the fields.

      This method finalizes the current transaction.

      This method shows how much money is in the cash register.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller(RegistryCreator registers,
                  Printer printer)
        Creates the controller and assigns values to the fields.
        Parameters:
        registers - is used to get access to the faux data base that is used within this program.
        printer - is used to get access to the 'printer' used by this POS.

    • Method Detail

      • startNewSale

        public void startNewSale()
        Initiates a new sale.

      • scanItem

        public SaleDTO scanItem(int quantity,
                        int itemID)
                 throws ItemNotFoundException,
                        DatabaseFailureException
        This method retrieves an Item object from the itemRegistry. This is then passed along to the sale class together with how many of this item are to be added to the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        quantity - how many of this Item have been added.
        itemID - the ID of the scanned item. Used to get the Item from the registry.
        Returns:
        the DTO containing the current state of the sale.
        Throws:
        ItemNotFoundException - Thrown if the provided ID is not associated with an Item
        DatabaseFailureException

      • scanItem

        public SaleDTO scanItem(int itemID)
                 throws ItemNotFoundException,
                        DatabaseFailureException
        An alternative version of the method above. It is used if no quantity is used.
        Parameters:
        itemID - the item to be added.
        Returns:
        the DTO containing the current state of the sale.
        Throws:
        ItemNotFoundException - Thrown if the provided ID is not associated with an Item
        DatabaseFailureException

      • finalizeSale

        public TotalPriceDTO finalizeSale()
        This method finalizes the current transaction.
        Returns:
        DTO containing the final price.

      • isEligibleForDiscount

        public TotalPriceDTO isEligibleForDiscount(int customerID)
        Used to find the discount associated with the customer ID and then applying it to the price to be paid.
        Parameters:
        customerID - used to check if the customer is eligible for a discount.
        Returns:
        DTO containing the new total.

      • pay

        public AmountOfMoney pay(AmountOfMoney paidAmount)
                  throws InsufficientFundsException
        This method sends the payment to the sale. It uses the final sale information to generate a receipt which is then printed. It also updates the external systems.
        Parameters:
        paidAmount - the amount of money the customer has paid.
        Returns:
        the change remaining after paying.
        Throws:
        InsufficientFundsException

      • getCashRegisterBalance

        public AmountOfMoney getCashRegisterBalance()
        This method shows how much money is in the cash register.
        Returns:
        the current balance in the cash register.
